description: Given statements describe STATE/PRECONDITIONS, not actions or functionality. Given = what exists before test. When = first action. Then = expected behavior. Example: Given user is logged in (state), not Given user logs in (action).

do.description: Given describes state/preconditions only. Example: 'Given user is logged in' (state), 'Given character sheet exists' (precondition)

guidance.description: Use state language - what EXISTS, not what HAPPENS
example: Given bot has behavior configured as 'shape'

guidance.description: First action is always When, never Given
Preconditions describe what's true BEFORE the action
example: Then activity log captures data (functionality being tested)

dont.description: Don't describe actions, UI navigation, or functionality in Given. Example: 'Given user logs in' (action - wrong), 'Given User is on PaymentDetails step' (navigation - wrong)

guidance.description: Don't use action verbs in Given - clicking, sending, calling are When actions
Don't describe UI position/navigation as state - 'is on page' is navigation, not domain state
example: Given User is on PaymentDetails step (WRONG - navigation, not state)
Given User is viewing the form (WRONG - UI position)
Given User is at Step 2 (WRONG - navigation position)
CORRECT: Given {WirePayment} creation is in progress

guidance.description: Don't describe functionality being tested in Given - that's what Then is for
example: Given activity log tracks: timestamp, action_state (WRONG - this is functionality to test in Then)

guidance.description: Don't use past tense actions in Given
example: Given Tool has invoked method (WRONG - 'invoked' is action)
Given user has clicked (WRONG - 'clicked' is action)
